def.dt: :a boy or man who has one or both of the same parents as you my little/younger brother her big/older brother Her brother was adopted. compare brother-in-law half brother stepbrother
:a man who is from the same group or country as you his college fraternity brothers We must support our brothers and sisters fighting overseas.
:a male member of a religious group the brothers in a monastery used especially as a title Brother John
:a black man used especially by African-Americans

dt.un: used when talking to a man Brother, do you have an extra cigarette? Brother, you have got to relax.
used as an interjection to express surprise or annoyance Brother was I ever sick. [=I was very sick] Oh, brother!
used especially to begin to talk in a formal way to a group of people or to refer to the members of a particular group Welcome, brethren. our church brethren

def.dt: :the brother of your husband or wife
:a powerful government or organization that watches and controls what people say and do “You better be careful about what you say,” she warned, “Big Brother is listening!” see also big 7
:a man or boy who has promised to be loyal to another man or boy usually in a ceremony in which they mix their blood He would never betray me—he's my blood brother.
:a brother with the same father but a different mother or the same mother but a different father George is my half brother.
:a black man or boy called also brother
